ul.li: Santa Clara Valley, California, United States

div.p: In this role you will be responsible for a combination of analysis, modeling, and building production services for internal use. You will work in a cross-functional team requiring creative problem solving and you’ll get to put these ideas into practice.

ul.li: Design for latency, design for throughput
Distributed systems concepts (CAP, “Fallacies of Distributed Computing,” etc)

div.p: We’re seeking candidates who are confident in moving forward executing their own ideas but humble enough to view their own work with healthy scrutiny. Willingness to give and receive feedback is required for success. An ideal candidate is a strong software engineer who is equally comfortable working through statistical modeling exercises and communicating their work with the wider team.

- Understanding of basic statistics and modeling - Parallel computing (java.util.concurrent, CSP, etc) - Networking fundamentals (HTTP/HTTPS, TCP, UDP) - Compute fundamentals (concurrency models, distributed single-threaded versus coordinated multithreaded scheduling, synchronous and asynchronous IO) - Storage fundamentals (disk types and drive layouts, random and sequential IO, compaction)
Experience with or strong desire to learn: - Modern Java (Java 8, streams, closures, try-with-resources, annotations, etc) - Dynamic scripting languages for quick analysis (bash, awk, sed, Python, etc) - Apache projects like Spark, HDFS, Hadoop, etc - Relational databases such as PostgreSQL - Presentation quality data visualization
We don’t expect you’re an expert in everything described above, but we do hope you have strong experience in a few areas, and enough curiosity + desire to become skilled in others. If this position sounds like a good match for your interests and skills, please consider applying. You’ve found a unique team and a place to make a significant impact on Apple’s future.
